citeinfo.origin: Remote Sensing and Geographic Information Group, U.S. Bureau of Reclamation, Denver Technical Center.
citeinfo.title: Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site Vegetation Mapping Project - Observation Points

descript.abstract:
The data collection for Hubbell Trading Post used an "Observation Point" form which is identical to the data collection protocols descibed by the USGS-NPS accuracy assessment protocols of larger parks. This data form collects enough data to assign an existing vegetation association to that point.
Prior to the field visit all interpreted vegetation polygons were assigned a numeric ID. The field crew visited the majority of polygons. Both polygons within the Park boundary and in the surrounding environs were visited. For each observation point, field photographs were recorded in several directions. Not all polygons received a visit. The crew concentrated their time on the largest and ecologically more interesting polygons.
descript.purpose: Determing the vegetation cover at Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site using the National Vegetation Classification System.
descript.supplinf: The shapefile was imported into a geodatabase by the USGS/CSS/Core Science Analytics and Synthesis.

attracc.attraccr: Vegetation recorded was compared to descriptions published by NatureServe.

procstep.procdesc: Observation point locations were recorded using a GPS unit.
The Shapefile was imported into a geodatabase by the USGS/CSS/Core Science Analytics and Synthesis.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypd: Feature class attribute table. Observation Points for vegetation classification.

attr.attrdef: Unique code for each field plot.
Point type (accuracy assessment point, observation point or plot point)

enttyp.enttypd: Defines relationship between Veg points and basic plot attributes

The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. Any related graphics (if available) are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not approriate to use the related graphics as data.
The U.S. Geological Survey and the National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an U.S. Geological Survey and National Park Service servers and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data.
